SQLStoredProcedureSpec.Name: USR_USP_CREATESCANSESSIONTEXT
SQLStoredProcedureSpec.Author: Bill Elfstrom
SQLStoredProcedureSpec.CreateProcedureSQL:
create procedure dbo.USR_USP_CREATESCANSESSIONTEXT @ScanSession as nvarchar(68) OUTPUT
as begin
begin try
declare @Username nvarchar(128) = null declare @ChangeAgentID as uniqueidentifier
exec dbo.USP_CHANGEAGENT_GETORCREATECHANGEAGENT @ChangeAgentID output; set @Username = (select USERNAME from dbo.CHANGEAGENT where ID = @ChangeAgentID)
-- strip off everything before the backslash set @Username = RIGHT(@Username,(LEN(@Username))- (CHARINDEX('\',@Username)))
declare @CurrentDate as datetime set @CurrentDate = GETDATE()
declare @DateTimeStamp as nvarchar(40)
Set @DateTimeStamp = CAST(DATEPART(YYYY,@CurrentDate) AS VARCHAR(4)) + '_' + RIGHT('00' + CAST(DATEPART(MM,@CurrentDate) AS VARCHAR(2)), 2) + '_' + RIGHT('00' + CAST(DATEPART(DD,@CurrentDate) AS VARCHAR(2)), 2) + '_' + RIGHT('00' + CAST(DATEPART(HH,@CurrentDate) AS VARCHAR(2)), 2) + RIGHT('00' + CAST(DATEPART(MI,@CurrentDate) AS VARCHAR(2)), 2) + RIGHT('00' + CAST(DATEPART(SS,@CurrentDate) AS VARCHAR(2)), 2)
set @ScanSession = @Username + '_' + @DateTimeStamp
end try begin catch
-- Raise an error with the details of the exception declare @ErrMsg nvarchar(4000), @ErrSeverity int select @ErrMsg = ERROR_MESSAGE(), @ErrSeverity = ERROR_SEVERITY() raiserror(@ErrMsg, @ErrSeverity, 1)
end catch
end
